metadata.Title: CVE-2020-10702 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - low.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in QEMU in the implementation of the Pointer Authentication (PAuth) support for ARM introduced in version 4.0 and fixed in version 5.0.0. A general failure of the signature generation process caused every PAuth-enforced pointer to be signed with the same signature. A local attacker could obtain the signature of a protected pointer and abuse this flaw to bypass PAuth protection for all programs running on QEMU.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-10702` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

qemu - 1:4.2-3ubuntu5
qemu-block-extra - 1:4.2-3ubuntu5
qemu-guest-agent - 1:4.2-3ubuntu5
qemu-kvm - 1:4.2-3ubuntu5
qemu-system - 1:4.2-3ubuntu5
qemu-system-arm - 1:4.2-3ubuntu5
qemu-system-common - 1:4.2-3ubuntu5
qemu-system-data - 1:4.2-3ubuntu5
qemu-system-gui - 1:4.2-3ubuntu5
qemu-system-mips - 1:4.2-3ubuntu5
qemu-system-misc - 1:4.2-3ubuntu5
qemu-system-ppc - 1:4.2-3ubuntu5
qemu-system-s390x - 1:4.2-3ubuntu5
qemu-system-sparc - 1:4.2-3ubuntu5
qemu-system-x86 - 1:4.2-3ubuntu5
qemu-system-x86-microvm - 1:4.2-3ubuntu5
qemu-system-x86-xen - 1:4.2-3ubuntu5
qemu-user - 1:4.2-3ubuntu5
qemu-user-binfmt - 1:4.2-3ubuntu5
qemu-user-static - 1:4.2-3ubuntu5
qemu-utils - 1:4.2-3ubuntu5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: qemu package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:4.2-3ubuntu5').
